definitions.definition: a shelter made of a large sheet of canvas, nylon, etc. that is supported by poles and ropes fixed to the ground, and is used especially for camping

examples.text: Food will be served in the hospitality tent *(= for example at an outdoor show)*.
Everyone was sleeping outside in tents.
The refugees had been living in makeshift tents for a year.
The reporters were waiting for the winners to come to the press tent.
There was a long queue of troops outside the cookhouse tent.
A tent city housing refugees from the war sprang up.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French tente, based on Latin tent- ‘stretched’, from the verb tendere.
